Frame 1:
The OL-in-One Compass (read ‘OL’ as ‘all’) is a
multi-use platform aiming at making Ocean Literacy (OL)
theory and practice more accessible for all.
Frame 2:
Ocean Literacy is quite simple.
The more one understands the Ocean-humanity
mutual influence, and the more one acts accordingly,
the more that person is ‘ocean literate’.
Frame 3:
Yet, proper “OL thinking & doing”
entails some complexity as it occurs
through three main lenses:
Frame 8:
OL Principles
summarize the
7 essential traits
of the Ocean,
clarifying why
it is the most
vital ecosystem
on Earth.
Frame 9:
OL Perspectives
encompass the
7 main angles
from which the
Ocean’s many
facets can be
understood and
put in context.
Frame 10:
OL Dimensions
outline the 10
main ways of
learning about
and reconnecting
with the Ocean.
Frame 11:
This layered view
does not reflect any
hierarchy, but simply
results from OL’s
evolution over time.
Frame 12:
Nonetheless,
it is useful to think
of OL Principles,
Perspectives and
Dimensions in
integrated ways,
for instance in terms
of what, from what
angle, and how.
Frame 13:
An expanded view of OL suggests to go beyond ad hoc “OL activities”,
considering instead the OL outcome that any sea-related activity
might, intentionally or unintentionally, produce.
Frame 14:
Thinking with OL Principles, Perspectives and Dimensions
thus becomes a way to be intentional about pursuing OL outcomes,
capturing and communicating their many facets.
Frame 15:
Ready to try out
“OL thinking & doing”?
